on reading compounds: 弁【ベン】speech, tongue, talk, eloquence, dialect, brogue, accent, bento, Japanese box lunch, petal, valve, Oversight Department, division of the daijokan under the ritsuryo system responsible for controlling central and provincial governmental offices
弁慶【ベンケイ】strong person, person putting on a brave front, bamboo tube with holes drilled in it (used as a stand for kitchen utensils, fans, etc.), checks, plaid, checked pattern
明弁【メイベン】discernment, clear analysis, clear expression, distinguished speech
用弁【ヨウベン】finishing one's business, settling an affair
kun reading compounds: 弁える【わきまえる】to discern (e.g. right from wrong), to discriminate, to distinguish, to know (manners, one's place, etc.), to understand, to bear in mind
